last_episode_to_air.name: Ladies First: 1989
last_episode_to_air.overview: LADIES FIRST by Queen Latifah: At the height of hip hop's misogynistic themes, the culture bows down to their queens of rap.

name: Hip Hop: The Songs That Shook America
original_name: Hip Hop: The Songs That Shook America
overview: A documentary series where each episode focuses on a groundbreaking song pivotal to the evolution of American music and culture.

episodes.name: Jesus Walks: 2004
episodes.overview: “Jesus Walks” by Kanye West: in an era of excess, a Christian rap song challenges the church and changes its own ideals about religion and rap music.

episodes.name: Alright: 2015
episodes.overview: “Alright” by Kendrick Lamar: making protest music in the era of Black Lives Matter, “Alright” becomes the unsaid anthem for hope.

episodes.name: Rock Box: 1984
episodes.overview: ROCK BOX by Run-DMC: How one song tore down the barriers between rock & hip hop, race and class on American radio and television.

episodes.name: Elevators: 1996
episodes.overview: ELEVATORS by OutKast: Hip hop's southern voice breaks through with an unsuspecting song that redefines rap's cultural and geographic boundaries.

episodes.name: The Bridge: 1986
episodes.overview: THE BRIDGE by Marley Marl and MC Shan: A song designed to foster community pride, ignites hip hop's most epic rap battle.

episodes.name: Ladies First: 1989
episodes.overview: LADIES FIRST by Queen Latifah: At the height of hip hop's misogynistic themes, the culture bows down to their queens of rap.
